alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Chaves County Plains; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:46PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN LINCOLN...SOUTHWESTERN DE BACA...NORTHWESTERN CHAVES AND SOUTHEASTERN TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM MDT... At 745 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mesa to 21 miles southwest of Ramon to 13 miles north of Arabela to 12 miles east of Elk. Movement was northwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Ruidoso, Corona, Lincoln, Capitan, Mesa, Tinnie, Glencoe, Encinoso, Arabela and Fort Stanton. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 152 and 172. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 85 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
